comments.body:
It appears there is already an existing thread on this topic (or something very similar). Feel free to join that discussion in progress. Cutting down on threads with very similar ideas will ideas to stay together so they can receive the attention they deserve from our developers. Even though you may not agree with all the exact ideas in the other thread(s), we love it when the community works together on ideas!

Thanks for your contribution.
You forget to add breakers, would love to see you collecting all that gunpowder just to automate tree farms, just get a block breaker dev it shouldn't be that hard.
As redstone/automation fanatic this should be added asap, huge improvement in many automations.
this will be so useful for farms. we really need this.
Yes! And what if the powerful laser also broke certain natural blocks like dirt, wood, and stone.
I would also like lasers that burn you if you try and go through them. This can be used for security.
You could make the laser from a dispenser and just use the new target blocks as recievers. Functionally that could be useful and effective as an addition to redstone contraptions

This is really cool I would be a beater redstoner and this is just like trip wire how ever it can go up I can see this being made out of this crafting recipe 

                                     Glass   Glass  Glass

                                      Quartz   redstone Quartz 

                                      Cobblestone observer Cobblestone 

this I can really see this
Yeah i would really this. It would be cool to be able to protect stuff
Tnt duping is a bug so I don't think it is likely to be added in bedrock. Besides, bedrock redstone can be a bit finnicky so it might not be able to work.
Either add it to Bedrock or remove it from Java!

You can practically still make tunnel bores or drill holes with tnt redstone machines on Bedrock. The difference is that you need a gunpowder farm and then a lot of sand. You could make bomber planes more easily than on Java due to being able to move dispensers with pistons. Though getting all the tnt is tedious in some cases, it makes more insensitive for other gameplay mechanics such as a creeper farm. Either Java’s or bedrocks method of handling tnt drilling are handled well, bedrock’s just happens to be more costly.

I agree, but we (we bedrock players) can move stuff like crafting tables, and dispensers (tile entities). The duper is a glitch that they decided to leave alone. I hope they add the glitch, but probably not :(
I voted for it
You could make a upwards minecart system but I see that has TONS of issues, so a upwards hopper would be NICE!
Maybe the rising funnel is made of copper.
maybe the copper funnal could be an add on
You can do this with bubble water streams. The only limitation being, you cant do it in the nether.
Water elevators are too big for some redstone contraptions and an upwards hopper would be awesome.

This would be great but you could make it a closed system that needs a hopper to feed into it rather than you directly as opening the bottom would make everything fall out seen as it's upside down and instead of needing it powered, how about it can only dispense upwards when it's items are full and adding one in pushes one upwards into another one or a different container such as a chest or regular hopper

I would love a sandstone pressure plate and button, but I don’t like that it breaks. Even though that is a very cool Redstone concept, it would be used a lot in building. If it broke when someone walked on the plate or pressed a button, it would make the item not good for building.
So it is a variant of the stone pressure plate?

I feel like the redstone community would love this idea! Have you considered moving your post to their category? It seems like something they might appreciate, but that might be difficult to find in a crowded section like blocks, tools, and items.
Great but no wax needed
No highly conductive redstone would have to act like the old redstone, new players need to be able to use redstone without having to craft it each time.
So, basically gold redstone?
I agree with you so much.It can be changed to greenstone, which can be distinguished from red stone, and maybe more interesting circuits can be made.

i think we should just get rid of the new redstone altogether

it will break any curcit with a redcoder in it wich is a surprising amount
Maybe the crafting recipe should be a Redstone dust and a golden nugget because gold is very conductive of electricity.
Activate redstone next to a Hopper; this should stop items from getting in and out.
Just lock the hopper with redstone
AKAMIKAZEL wants to permanently stop the hopper from picking up items but locking with redstone will also stop it from pushing items, turning it into a really small chest, and who wants that?
So, basically this would be an item pipe?!

Are you talking about the hopper lid being a separate block, or a variant of the hopper that has a lid on it? If it's the former one, I don't see the advantage over just using a furnace on the top. If it's the latter one, I think it would be less confusing to call it a "lidded hopper", and it has already been suggested under the name "Covered Hopper".

I like this idea  : acts like a hopper for moving items, but doesn't constantly search for items and cuts down on lag :)
I was about to submit something similar but you already had :)

Idk if that guy knows what you are talking about. I will ask what I think to confirm if it is what u r talking about because i want to know if it still works. From java there was the thing where putting furnaces on top of hoppers reduced lag... with the added benefit of no items falling in.

I didn't understand update 3

What version are your comments on? i play bedrock
building mumbo jumbo tutorials on bedrock is not easy it has to modified like extra redstone setting repeaters to different ticks to get it working

I don’t think it hard to do this.

Just add some doing order and it will help a lot with redstoner in bedrock eidition
even a double piston extender only works half the time on bedrock without extra delay
I think it's the timing that's the problem. Whatever timing system it's running on. Something about running on your consol's clock vrs. running on gameplay ticks?
In Java Redstone, I know that more people are using rails and observers instead of Redstone and repeaters. This is not possible in bedrock Redstone, is it?

I just converted my java world into bedrock and i knew it wouldnt be perfect but practically every redstone thing i have made is broken. It really sucks cos Bedrock would be ideal for playing on my world on the go but not if everything i have already built doesnt work! I really wish the redstone behaved like it does in java, then there would be way more chance of me playing this version, for now i am sticking with java! Also one of my builds has a minecart rail on top of a structure block and apparently that is impossible on this version?
Yes please it’s so hard
I think the warden drop should be something a bit more impactful and useful, but I do think this block could be good especially if it'll be movable by pistons
what if the skulk sensor had a way to only pick up certain sounds. (mind blown)
I thought Mojang didn't want you to kill a Warden??
we have an sculk catalyst as its drop and its unkillable how greedy the communtiy is?!

I personally don't want it to be dropped by the warden, but in its current state, the warden is alot like the wither in hardmode. If Mojang doesn't want people to beat it without redstone, then they should make it a bit harder.
I really like the idea of a dart. It wouldn't just find good use with target blocks, put also with traps.
i agree a dart would be cool, maybe you could use a spider eye to poison them, and shoot them with a blowdart made from bamboo
It is a good idea but the best uses would be?
Good idea man, I was just about to suggest this but then I saw your post, so I instead voted for it. Keep up the good ideas!
I really hope Minecraft puts this in because the Redstone randomizers would be so much easier
I always thought minecraft needed randomizers... I was going to make a suggestion, but you already did it!

This would be so helpful for making randomized minigames in survival. Imagine you wanted to make a random dungeon layout or just add some random element to things. Right now the random circuit invovles a dropper, a hopper, a non-stackable item, a stackable item, and a long stretch of redstone dust with repeaters and redstone torches, and it only has 2 outputs! This would make life so much better and have an additional output too! Mojang should really consider this.
I was about to post this idea, but saw someone else already did. I can’t believe this hasn’t been added already! I voted for this the second I saw it
The current redstone randomizers are extremely small. However, this would add a way to get 1 in 3 randomization.
There could be an inverted version.

It can change when its oxidised. Maybe stage 1 allows the door to be opened and closed normally, while the next stages give it the copper bulb mechanic. With that, I also think it would be interesting if the final stage made it work like an iron door, but that might be a little too much.
This this would change Minecraft
This can kind of be done using a comparator and something in an item frame, but I guess it would be nice to have a simpler way to do the same thing.
Instead what I would do is every time you click on the Crank, it acts like one redstone signal or just wherever you stand on one side or the other it goes the opposite way
Observers detect when it was rang, you do not need a signal to come out
Hi! I've published this idea as well. Do you want to team up?
Seems a bit op to me.
Should be expensive.

Please vote for this!!! (My post got deleted, but if You need some ideas:
Skulk Sensors can be Trained to only hear a specific thing
If you feed a skulk sensor with the drop of the Warden (f.e. The dark heart, valuable), it will listen to its environment until it hears something. This sound event will be memorized. From now on it will only hear that specific sound. The other sounds will get filtered out. Besides, the visual appearance changes as it uses the "filter-mode". If you break it with a netherite pickaxe, it resets to the normal mode and gets dropped together with the dark heart. You can feed the skulk sensor only with one dark heart.

This would create a whole variety of new useful mechanics. Since Minecraft never had a feature like this, it would fit in quite well. Please help us to make Minecraft revolutionary!)
Unfortunately for you, I have heard from SimplySarc's comment section from that video that storing a lot of data in a single block causes lag.

Brilliant idea! this would mean you could tile flying machines easier and also make them look a lot nicer in medieval builds. best of all, flying machines could fit in 1 wide spaces and we wouldnt have to rely on terracotta, which looks out of place 8 times out of 10
I don't like it being one time use but I do like it being almost invisible.

"I don't like it being one time use but I do like it being almost invisible."

Same here
How about instead of being one time use, it measures the fall distance of entities dropped onto it? It would be an interesting mechanic.
CataclysmSolace seems like a whole different item.
I agree other than it being a one time use, I'd rather it was like a normal pressure plate but mostly invisible.

This is already possible by emptying the items into a double chest and using two hoppers under the chest to suck the items out of it. They won't add a feature if it can already be easily accomplished another way.
that does not work unless double chest is full.

this would be great for storages systems operation at y level 1 eg an enderman farm in which gnembon's design utilises a farm centred on three blocks so it's hard to split them evenly causing some hoppers to be backlogged and others empty.
I think that this is a great idea but if this were done it would also be helpful if there was a way to block items from going in so you can temporarily stop something if you want

The main reason I suggested this is because of an auto charcoal maker I built. It uses a dropper to refuel itself with the charcoal it was producing. I had to waste 9 stacks of charcoal per module just to back stuff the droppers. There is no current solution in the game. The other uses mentioned above are extra ways this item would be useful.

I'm not sure this would work very well with a comparator. If the comparator doesn't count the eliminators, either its output power level would be restricted to less than 15 or the correspondence between inventory item counts and output level would become variable, which means you'd have to calculate it separately for each case where eliminators were used. Either option would be viable, but would require a custom-designed circuit configuration for every use case involving eliminators, and the circuit could fail if the number of eliminators ever changes. It's not undoable, but kind of complicated in a way that's inconsistent with the rest of redstone. I definitely don't see it making it easier to use comparators.

as far as comparators are concerned it would help for inventories like droppers that have nine slots. 15/9 dose not come out evenly and can be difficult to work with but if you where able to eliminate four slots the five left would be a lot easier to calculate.
Just use poisonous potatoes mate. Or just potatoes for that matter.
This doesn't add any functionality. If you want to know what a comparator will output, do your research instead of making it the devs' problem.
buena idea, pienso en lo mismo
This means fundamentally changing how Redstone itself works. 1RT=2T. Though I do think changing the crafter to being 1 game tick would be the best option (with 0 ticks being fairly op)

This could be a thing, but I feel like it would require a setting to be activated in order for it to be allowed on servers (being disabled by default). You wouldn't want this to exist on really large servers because this can bog them down greatly.

 

By itself, great idea in concept, I just think it could end badly if this was the default functionality. I prefer to just use them to navigate the world easier and not get lost.
In my opinion a way to force load chunks is good but(at least by default) it should only be for admins to use, like command blocks.

I think this is a great idea, and it would be really cool to see it added, although this should be a gameplay setting that you could activate on the gameplay setting, to prevent connection issues and lag.
It should also detect campfire smoke that goes directly in it
I would like to see a way to activate redstone contraptions with fire as well. It would be like lighting torches in a Zelda game to open a door.

*no space above
Also, the Hopper pipes will be able to move items upwards, and a straight pipe can't accept items from hoppers, but only other pipes.
Amazing idea!
I luv it ❤️
Just use javas update order

man i am tired of wondering if my contraptions will work being a case of "lets go gambling!"

for refrence i am making a 4x4 door of which update order and a few other parity issues are making it go from a small task to making a 10x10 door on java
